definition[0]: to arrive, especially at the place where someone is waiting for you
example[0]: Seth showed up, apologising for being late.
example[1]: We had 200 people show up for our seminar.
definition[1]: to make it possible to see or notice something that was not clear before
example[2]: The sunlight showed up the marks on the window.
definition[2]: to be easy to see or notice
example[3]: Use a light colour which will show up on a dark background.
definition[3]: to make someone feel embarrassed by behaving in a stupid or unacceptable way when you are with them
example[4]: She says I showed her up in front of her friends when they came to the house.
